page.title: 14Winterbourne J Girls'School
page.content: The school's old building was established in 1893. It now occupies the annexe building which was the Heath Clark School. It has always been a single sex primary school serving the local community. Older pupils in their "eighties" recollect the Ursuline Convent nearby on the London Road, an orchard at Goston Gardens and rose nurseries stretching to Mitcham Common. School began at 9a.m and ended at four o'clock. Two hours' lunch break enabled children to go home for dinner. The School Bell in the Tower marked the passage of time. Girls were not caned but were smacked for misdemeanours. Playground games have changed little, jacks, skipping, french skipping, two balls still remain popular. Holidays were infrequent and pocket money seemed to be about 2 1/2p per week.
